featured.text: Until then, people did not usually eat or drink anything between lunch and dinner.
As for our neighbors, they liked to invite my father to dinner so that they could tell him stories about their children, parents, friends, and pets.
When holding a dinner party, some large restaurants or hotels will use an ice sculpture to decorate the table.
Do you feel TV dinners too unhealthy?
With hot stoves, boiling water and sharp knives at hand, it is understandable that parents don’t want children in the kitchen when they’re making dinner.

other.text: In the chicken house, there were four old chickens, waiting to be killed (28) Sunday’s dinner.
"And it will be a dinner to remember.
We shall expect you at eight o’clock; , it’s an informal dinner.
By this time the cook was angry and decided to do exactly what the dinner guest wanted: slice the potatoes as thin as possible.
I thanked him (36) but he insisted that we should go there for dinner.
But there is one thing he would never forget: showing up for dinner on time.
The cook’s plan to stop the dinner guest from complaining did not turn out as he had planned.
After dinner, Richard offered to pay the bill, but May insisted that they do it .
The dinner was great indeed, but the coffee they served was quite different.

definition.zh_def: 晚餐，通常是一天中最後一餐，通常在晚上享用。
definition.en_def: The main meal of the day, typically eaten in the evening.
definition.example: We had spaghetti for dinner last night.
